Mr Justice Holman, sitting in London, allowed challenges by six councils, including Sand-well, declaring Mr Michael Gove had unlawfully failed to consult them before the cuts. In five of the cases the failure was so unfair as to amount to an abuse of power, said the judge. He said: "However pressing the economic problems, there was no overriding public interest which precluded consultation or justifies the lack of any consultation." Mr Michael Gove 's decision-making

In Washington, Donald Rumsfeld was known as a tenacious and effective fighter of policy wars, once described by Henry Kissinger as a skilled full-time politician-bureaucrat in whom ambition, ability, and substance fuse seamlessly. In the 1970s, as chief of staff and then defense secretary in the Gerald Ford administration, Donald Rumsfeld clashed with Henry Kissinger , then secretary of state, with Donald Rumsfeld opposing- and helping to prevent, by many accounts-
